content.text:
[b]Career Fair[/b]
[i]In order to survive through to The Recruiter you must market yourself to job reps from various companies. Good luck and remember, the goal is to get hired after convincing The Recruiter you're the right person for the job.[/i]

To move press [outline=#f1fc00][b]W[/b][/outline], [outline=#f1fc00][b]A[/b][/outline], [outline=#f1fc00][b]S[/b][/outline], [outline=#f1fc00][b]D[/b][/outline]

To market yourself, toss your resume towards the job rep using the [outline=#f1fc00][b]Left Mouse Button[/b][/outline].

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: westboy, daliyoucefmedakram@gmail.com
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Animate the text to simulate it being written character by character (also called "typewriter" effect), with a customizable time between each character. Useful for dialogue scenes or visual novels.

Add the behavior to a Text object (or BBText object) and choose the interval between characters.

* When the text changes, the automatic typing starts again from the beginning with the new text.
* You can change the speed of the text typing by changing the interval with events.
* Use a condition to check if the typing finished.
* You can also pause the typing and resume it after.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.fullName: Auto typing animation for texts ("typewriter" effect)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: AutoTyping
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Animate the text to simulate it being written character by character (also called "typewriter" effect), with a customizable time between each character. Useful for dialogue scenes or visual novels.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Animate the text to simulate it being written character by character (also called "typewriter" effect), with a customizable time between each character. Add the behavior to the object, and it will get animated when the text is changed. You can also pause/resume it.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Text_AutoTyping

eventsFunctions.description: Execute actions when the auto typing text ends.
eventsFunctions.name: TypingFinished

eventsFunctions.description: Detect if the auto typing is on pause.
eventsFunctions.name: TypingPause

eventsFunctions.description: Change the time between characters being typed.
eventsFunctions.name: ChangeInterval
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set the interval between characters of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Animate the text to simulate it being written character by character (also called "typewriter" effect), with a customizable time between each character. Add the behavior to the object, and it will get animated when the text is changed. You can also pause/resume it.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: BBText_AutoTyping

eventsFunctions.description: Execute actions when the auto typing text ends.
eventsFunctions.name: TypingFinished

eventsFunctions.description: Detect if the auto typing is on pause.
eventsFunctions.name: TypingPause

eventsFunctions.description: Change the time between characters being typed.
eventsFunctions.name: ChangeInterval
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set the interval between characters of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Allow the object to fire bullets, with customizable speed, angle and fire rate.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: FireBullet
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Allow the object to fire bullets, with customizable speed, angle and fire rate.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Allow the object to fire bullets, with customizable speed, angle and fire rate.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: FireBullet

eventsFunctions.description: Fire a bullet toward a position
eventsFunctions.fullName: Fire a bullet toward a position
eventsFunctions.name: FireTowardPosition
eventsFunctions.sentence: Fire _PARAM4_ from _PARAM0_, at position _PARAM2_;_PARAM3_, toward position _PARAM5_;_PARAM6_ with speed _PARAM7_ px/s

parameters.description: X position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: XPosition

parameters.description: Y position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: YPosition

parameters.description: Speed of the bullet, in pixels per second
parameters.name: Speed

eventsFunctions.name: Fire
eventsFunctions.sentence: Fire _PARAM4_ from _PARAM0_, at position _PARAM2_;_PARAM3_, with angle _PARAM5_ and speed _PARAM6_ px/s

parameters.description: X position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: XPosition

parameters.description: Y position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: YPosition

parameters.description: Angle of the bullet, in degrees
parameters.name: Angle

parameters.description: Speed of the bullet, in pixels per second
parameters.name: Speed

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object has just fired something.
eventsFunctions.name: HasJustFired

propertyDescriptors.label: Cooldown, in seconds, before firing again
propertyDescriptors.name: FireCooldown

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: westboy31, Tristan Rhodes (tristan@victrisgames.com)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Ideal for explosions, hit/impacts, earthquake, etc.

> See [an example of using this extension here](https://victrisgames.itch.io/gdevelop-camera-shake-example).

Select one or more methods of shaking:

- Position:  Shake the X and Y position of the camera 
- Angle: Shake the rotation of the camera 
- Zoom: Shake the zoom level of the camera 

Control how long and how fast the camera shakes:

- Duration: Amount of time to shake the camera
- Time between shakes: Amount of time between each change of the movement of the camera
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CameraShake
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Shake the camera on the specified layer using one or more methods of shaking (position, angle, zoom)

eventsFunctions.description: Shake the camera on the specified layer, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, zoom)
eventsFunctions.name: CameraShake
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shake camera #_PARAM4_ on _PARAM3_ layer for _PARAM5_ seconds. Use an amplitude of _PARAM1_px on X axis and _PARAM2_px on Y axis, angle rotation amplitude _PARAM6_ degrees, and zoom amplitude _PARAM7_ percent.  Wait _PARAM8_ seconds between shakes.

events.comment: Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
Add default values if none were provided
If a shake is not in progress, save initial values.

parameters.description: Amplitude of shaking on the X axis (pixels) (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerX

parameters.description: Amplitude of shaking on the Y axis (pixels) (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerY

events.comment: Stop shaking when the duration has been reached
Calculate shake displacement once per shake timer
Calculate object position displacement, with linear decay over time
Calculate object angle displacement, with linear decay over time
Calculate camera zoome displacement, with linear decay over time
Caclulate the fraction of progress towards shake destination (based on timer)
Increase percentage from 0 to 1 for the first half of the shake:  2 * ((ShakeDuration - ShakeTimer) / ShakeDuration)
Decrease percentage from 1 to 0 for the second half of the shake: 2 - 2 * ((ShakeDuration - ShakeTimer) / ShakeDuration)
Always keep camera adjusted with current displacement values

eventsFunctions.description: Check if a camera shake is in progress.
eventsFunctions.name: IsShaking

eventsFunctions.description: Stop all camera shaking that was initiated by the Camera Shake extension.
eventsFunctions.name: StopShaking
